org.bsiet.combinations

Class LabelledSpinner

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledSpinner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class LabelledSpinner
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    The Java Wizard Development team

    Use

    A component that gives you JLabel and JSpinner next to it as a single component aligned in GroupLayout.
    You can even choose whether you want its alignment in HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL orientation.
    It supports all methods supported by both JLabel and JSpinner.
    This component is returned in JPanel. So you either can initialize it as object or can store it in JPanel too.

    Sample Class


    import javax.swing.JPanel;
    import org.bsiet.combinations.LabelledSpinner;
    import org.bsiet.layouts.MyLayout;

    public class LabelledSpinnerSample extends JPanel {

    LabelledSpinner spin1, spin2;

    public LabelledSpinnerSample()
    {
    spin1 = new LabelledSpinner("Spinner1");
    spin2 = new LabelledSpinner("Spinner2", true);

    MyLayout ml = new MyLayout(new Object[]{spin1, spin2}, true);
    add(ml);
    }
    }
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
